title: identity/name/substitude for this script face
content:
dear typophiles,

i am in need for the name or a similar substitude for the penmen-like script typeface attached.

had no luck with my sources or whatthefont so far.

any help or even identification would be great ;)

best, steffen

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [typeface\_hint.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020103348/http:/typophile.com/files/typeface_hint.jpg) | 82.96 KB |
author: steff_en

comments.content: Don't know it, but you can find many more like it right [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020103348/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontcase/genres/copperplate_scripts/).

Stephen,

just wanted to send a little thanks for the reply.

I purchased a font from DS Type, Ventura.

Best, Steffen

The font is American Greeting Script, which was revived as Altast Greeting by NovelFonts. You can see the sample on [Page 1 of Part 1](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020103348/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/Script01Pg1.html) of the Script Guide. Several other digital versions exist including one by Opti.

- Mike Yanega
